item.title: Piping Windows EventLog to OpInsight (or other tcp endpoint)
item.description: Quick and Dirty Pipes the last 10 events from the kube-proxy source to OpInsight (or other tcp endpoint) in json format using Powershell. 1Get-EventLog -Source 'kube-proxy' -LogName 'EKS' -Newest 10 | ForEach-Object { 2 $Endpoint = https://eu.webhook.logs.insight.rapid7.com/v1/noformat/<YourToken>" 3 4 $JsonBody = @{ 5 "idx" = $_.Index, 6 "src" = $_.Source 7 "inst" = $_.InstanceId 8 "time" = $_.Time, 9 "event" = $_.Message, 10 } | ConvertTo-Json 11 12 Invoke-RestMethod -Method Post -Uri $Endpoint -Body $JsonBody -ContentType "application/json" 13} You can of course use a function but this is something I only tend to have to use if EKS’ managed windows nodes are misbehaving and I want to quickly pipe the logs to OpInsight for analysis.
